intro: Psychotria rufovaginata, commonly known as the red-stemmed Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, reddish stems and clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a smooth, glossy texture. Psychotria rufovaginata is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests.
